# Adding Competition Badge to Game Screens (2025-03-22 19:33:35)

_**User**_

What does the code do and where do I add it?

---

_**Assistant**_

Looking at the code you've shared, I can see you're working on a 3D cyberpunk parkour game, and you need to add a competition entry marker for the Vibe Jam 2025 competition.

## What the Code Does

The code snippet you provided is a small HTML element that creates a fixed position link in the bottom-right corner of your game. It displays "üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025" with some styling and links to the competition website (https://jam.pieter.com).

The key components:
- It's an `<a>` tag (hyperlink) that opens in a new tab
- It has specific styling to ensure it's visible but not intrusive
- It's positioned in the bottom-right corner of the screen
- It includes an emoji (üïπÔ∏è) and the text "Vibe Jam 2025"
- It has a z-index of 10000 to make sure it appears above other elements

## Where to Add It

Based on your code structure, there are two logical places to add this:

1. In the `createStartScreen()` function (for the home screen)
2. In the `startGame()` function (for the game screen)

Here's how to implement it:

```javascript:src/main.js
// ... existing code ...
function createStartScreen() {
    // ... existing code ...
    
    // Add controls info
    const controlsInfo = document.createElement('div');
    controlsInfo.className = 'controls-info';
    controlsInfo.innerHTML = 'CONTROLS:<br>WASD: Move | SPACE: Jump | SHIFT: Sprint | Q/E: Rotate Camera';
    startScreen.appendChild(controlsInfo);
    
    // Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge
    const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
    jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: -1px; right: -1px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10; border-top-left-radius: 12px; z-index: 10000; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
    document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
    
    // ... existing code ...
}

function startGame() {
    // ... existing code ...
    
    // Make sure the Vibe Jam badge persists when the game starts
    // (Only add this if you're not already keeping the badge from the start screen)
    // If you want a fresh badge, uncomment these lines:
    /*
    const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
    jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: -1px; right: -1px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10; border-top-left-radius: 12px; z-index: 10000; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
    document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
    */
    
    // ... existing code ...
}
// ... existing code ...
```

I recommend adding it primarily in `createStartScreen()` since it will persist throughout the game unless explicitly removed. Adding it only once at the beginning prevents duplicate badges from appearing.

This implementation places the badge in the bottom-right corner, but ensures it doesn't interfere with your gameplay or other UI elements due to its positioning and z-index.

_**Assistant**_

Looking at your existing code, I can see you already have some UI elements positioned at the bottom of the screen:

1. In the `startGame()` function, you've added a game signature:
   ```javascript
   // Add signature to the game screen
   const gameSignature = document.createElement('div');
   gameSignature.id = 'game-signature';
   gameSignature.innerHTML = 'Vibe Coded by <a href="https://x.com/faisalxshariff" target="_blank" style="color: #00ffff; text-decoration: none;">@faisalxshariff</a>';
   gameSignature.style.position = 'absolute';
   gameSignature.style.bottom = '10px';
   gameSignature.style.right = '10px';
   // ...more styling...
   ```

2. You also have controls info at the bottom left:
   ```html
   <div id="controls">WASD: Move | SPACE: Jump | SHIFT: Sprint</div>
   ```
   with CSS:
   ```css
   #controls { position: absolute; bottom: 10px; left: 10px; color: #0ff; background-color: rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.5); padding: 5px; border-radius: 5px; font-size: 12px; }
   ```

Yes, the competition badge might interfere with your existing game signature since both are positioned in the bottom-right corner. Here are two solutions:

### Option 1: Adjust the position of the Vibe Jam badge

```javascript:src/main.js
// Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge
const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: -1px; right: 120px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10; border-top-left-radius: 12px; z-index: 10000; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
```

This positions the badge about 120px from the right edge, giving space for your signature.

### Option 2: Move the badge to the bottom center

```javascript:src/main.js
// Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge
const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: -1px; left: 50%; transform: translateX(-50%); padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10; border-top-left-radius: 12px; border-top-right-radius: 12px; z-index: 10000; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
```

This centers the badge at the bottom of the screen, which would avoid both your signature on the right and controls on the left.

### Option 3: Place the badge in the top-right corner

```javascript:src/main.js
// Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge
const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; top: -1px; right: -1px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10000; border-bottom-left-radius: 12px; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
```

This moves the badge to the top-right corner completely away from your bottom UI elements.

I'd recommend Option 3 as it keeps the badge visible but completely avoids interfering with any of your existing UI elements at the bottom of the screen.

_**Assistant**_

If you want to place the Vibe Jam badge above your existing signature in the bottom right, you can specify the exact positioning to make sure they don't overlap. Here's how to position it:

```javascript:src/main.js
// Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge
const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: 40px; right: -1px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10000; border-top-left-radius: 12px; border-bottom-left-radius: 12px; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
```

The key change here is setting `bottom: 40px` which positions the badge about 40 pixels up from the bottom of the screen. This should leave enough space for your existing signature which is positioned at `bottom: 10px`.

If your existing signature is taller than 30 pixels, you might want to increase this value to ensure there's adequate separation between the two elements.

To add this in your `createStartScreen()` function:

```javascript:src/main.js
function createStartScreen() {
    // ... existing code ...
    
    // Add controls info
    const controlsInfo = document.createElement('div');
    controlsInfo.className = 'controls-info';
    controlsInfo.innerHTML = 'CONTROLS:<br>WASD: Move | SPACE: Jump | SHIFT: Sprint | Q/E: Rotate Camera';
    startScreen.appendChild(controlsInfo);
    
    // Add Vibe Jam 2025 competition badge above the signature in bottom right
    const jamBadge = document.createElement('div');
    jamBadge.id = 'jam-badge'; // Add ID for potential reference later
    jamBadge.innerHTML = '<a target="_blank" href="https://jam.pieter.com" style="font-family: \'system-ui\', sans-serif; position: fixed; bottom: 40px; right: -1px; padding: 7px; font-size: 14px; font-weight: bold; background: #fff; color: #000; text-decoration: none; z-index: 10000; border-top-left-radius: 12px; border-bottom-left-radius: 12px; border: 1px solid #fff;">üïπÔ∏è Vibe Jam 2025</a>';
    document.body.appendChild(jamBadge);
    
    // ... existing code ...
}
```

This placement should ensure the badge is always visible above your signature, without interfering with it or other UI elements.
